title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [29 march 1873]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [29 March 1873]
text: Saturday My dear Walti have received severallseveral papers this week but no letter that has been written this week i got one wrote last fridayFriday a week ago yesterday but i hope you are right well as they say here louLou has had quite a run of company this week mostly girls from the place where she used to work all have to be taken up in my room i stayed down in the kichenkitchen part of the time their discourse was not interesting to me but i got through it every body that comes has to be taken up here i dontdon't like it sometimesthere is no fire any where else to take any one but let it slide i have had a letter from helen price very good one she says mrsMrs. davisDavis wontwon't return till next spring and then katyKaty is hinds is going to uropeEurope the quenQueen that josepheineJosephine sailed in has arrived so i hope Jo is all safe so far) georgeGeorge has a prospect of getting the brooklynBrooklyn work he went on there last mondayMonday to see and adamsAdams gave him encouragement to think he would get it i hope of course he will but to hear the talk about money you would think their means was limited) louLou says the rent is more than it costs for provisions) write walterWalter dear the first of the weekyou got hansHan's letter and JeffsJeff'spoor matt i feel so bad about her i cantcan't keep her out of my mind there is a roof on the house so it dondon't leak Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [29 March 1873]
